result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob M Slayton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must report to probation no later than Tuesday May 17, 2016 by 3:00 PM.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
Must have no contact with Alexandria Murtaugh except as authorized by Probation Agent. Must maintain absolute sobriety.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. Must follow up with recommendations of psychological evaltuation that was previously completed. Must complete Access Domestic Violence Program, or similar program. Must submit DNA sample and pay the Surcharge.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

supervisions.notes: 5/29/18 AMENDED: COURT ORDERS AN INCREASE IN SENTENCE CREDIT FROM 84 DAYS TO 86 DAYS. 5/30/18 CORRECTED TO UPDATE THE TIME SERVED TO 86 DAYS AS ORDERED ON 5/29/18.
Outstanding financial obligations are reduced to Judgment.

Defendant Jacob M Slayton in court with attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington.  John Michael O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State moves to amend to three misdemeanor counts:  Count 1 - 940.19(1) Battery (no domestic abuse enhancer) - class A misdemeanor,  Count 2 - 943.14 trespass to dwelling - class A misdemeanor.  Count 3 - 947.01 Disorderly Conduct - class B misdemeanor.

No Information will be filed.

3:34 Court adjourns for Attorney Harringon to speak to defendant.

3:46 Recalled.
Court questions defendant.  Defendant pleads guilty to amended counts 1 - 3.  Court accepts and finds guilty to all three counts.

Bond continues.

Defense requests bond modification to allow defendant to reside at 1898 12 1/2 Ave Lot 22 in Cameron WI.
